content:
After submitting a modified version of the mobile app to the App and Play stores, I am trying to add push notifications. To this end, I use the instructions given at https://zulip.readthedocs.io/en/stable/production/mobile-push-notifications.html#sending-push-notifications-directly-from-your-server.

The iOS implementation works flawlessly, but I am struggling with the Android instructions, and would like to request guidance. Here are a couple of questions:

  1. What does the "FCM push notifications key in the Google Developer console" mentioned in #sending-push-notifications-directly-from-your-server refer to? Is it the current_key found in google-services.json? The key is meant to be stored as a string in /etc/zulip/zulip-secrets.conf (as android_gcm_api_key).

  2. Does the firebase.xml file need to be updated to reflect the clone's data?

  3. Are there other parameters to modify?
